intro: Koeleria bitczenachica, commonly known as the narrowleaf tufted grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its range.
